Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a healthy plant with water clearly showing its vibrant leaves and sufficient light exposure.
The student can draw an unhealthy plant lacking water, depicting wilted leaves and a drooping stem.
The student can clearly illustrate the concept that plants need water and light to live and grow through their drawing.
The student can identify and illustrate the pattern that plants with enough water and light are thriving, healthy, and growing.
The student can identify and illustrate the pattern that plants without adequate water and light appear unhealthy and failing to grow adequately.
CANNOT: The student might not include specific scientific labels for light and water, though they accurately portray them visually (minor gap in labeling).
